name: 11.3 "King of the Beers" Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 11 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did Sam think he'd bought?
questions.explanation:
Blood-pressure tester.

	He found out it was a slot machine. Everybody wanted to play it.

questions.text: What did Norm volunteer to do a survey on?
questions.explanation:
Beer tasting.

	The man told Norm he'd get paid for taking part in the survey. Norm asked the man if he was born in a manger.

questions.text: When Norm told the man it was too easy, how did the man respond?
questions.correct: Let's try samples D through V.
options: You're just too good at this.
questions.explanation:
Let's try samples D through V.

	Norm said he would need to cleanse his palette. He then asked for a pizza.

questions.text: Who thought the slot machine hated her?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca.

	She tried several times but each time she lost. Meanwhile, everyone else who was trying won.

questions.text: Why did Carla whisper when talking to Rebecca?
questions.correct: She didn't want the machine to know she was talking to Rebecca.
options: She didn't want to disturb the customers.
She had a bad cold and lost her voice.
She was told by Sam to be quiet.
questions.explanation:
She didn't want the machine to know she was talking to Rebecca.

	She told Rebecca she was acting crazy talking to a machine. She went on to explain the machine didn't care whose money it took.

questions.text: What was the name of Norm's supervisor?
questions.explanation:
Mike.

	Mike was played by Cliff Benis. Benis grew up on a dairy farm in Ohio. He was one of the original cast members of "Jaques Brel is Alive and Well and Living in Paris".

questions.text: When did Norm cry in this episode?
options: When he drank his first beer
When he met his new boss
questions.explanation:
When he saw the brewery.

	He then kissed the machine and said, "Honey I'm home." He told Mike he'd been ready to see the brewery for 43 years.

questions.text: How much did Sam pay Carla to rig the machine so Rebecca would win?
questions.explanation:
$20.

	Rebecca said she pulled the handle over 500 times and still hadn't won. She was convinced that she was a loser, so Sam wanted to cheer her up.

House of Pancakes.

	She asked Norm how one could not think so much. She then told him this story about how she choked when she met the big boss at her dream job.

questions.text: At the end of the episode, what did Rebecca say she was?
questions.explanation:
A break-evener.

	After Carla rigged the machine, Rebecca played the machine and got her nickle back. She said she had never broken even before. She was a "break-evener", and Norm was a loser.
